message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the World Economic Forum's Global Competitiveness Report to analyze the impact of corruption on firm-level productivity.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "World Economic Forum's Global Competitiveness Report"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize survey data collected in Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tanzania by the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program to assess the prevalence of child marriage and its association with educational attainment.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program"], "topic": ["Education", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper studies the effect of minimum wages on employment using a dataset of labor market outcomes from 22 OECD countries between 1982 and 2016.", "dataset": ["dataset of labor market outcomes"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from multiple sources such as the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture, the National Sample Survey Office, and the Central Statistics Office to understand the impact of agricultural insurance on farmer income and crop yields in India.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture", "National Sample Survey Office", "Central Statistics Office"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using high-resolution satellite imagery and census data from Bangladesh, we find that an increase in exposure to air pollution is significantly associated with lower height-for-age scores among children aged 0-59 months.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite imagery", "census data from Bangladesh"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on three datasets - the Humanitarian Data Exchange, the Multi-Cluster Initial Rapid Assessment, and the ReliefWeb Crisis Dashboard - to identify the most vulnerable populations during a humanitarian crisis and inform aid distribution.", "dataset": ["Humanitarian Data Exchange", "Multi-Cluster Initial Rapid Assessment", "ReliefWeb Crisis Dashboard"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset on global stranded assets in the fossil fuel industry to estimate the direct and indirect financial risks that climate change poses to investors.", "dataset": ["unique dataset on global stranded assets in the fossil fuel industry"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the relationship between international migration and remittance flows, we use data from two sources: the World Bank Migration and Remittances database and the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs database.", "dataset": ["World Bank Migration and Remittances database", "United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs database"], "topic": ["Migration", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from 10 African countries, we show that access to rural roads has a positive effect on dietary diversity and nutritional outcomes, but the effect varies depending on the type of crop grown in the area.", "dataset": ["household survey data from 10 African countries"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data from the World Health Organization's Global Urban Ambient Air Pollution Database and the World Bank's Population Density Database to estimate the health impacts of air pollution in urban areas around the world.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization's Global Urban Ambient Air Pollution Database", "World Bank's Population Density Database"], "topic": ["Health", "Urban Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the World Economic Forum's Global Competitiveness Report to analyze the impact of corruption on firm-level productivity.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "World Economic Forum's Global Competitiveness Report"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize survey data collected in Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tanzania by the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program to assess the prevalence of child marriage and its association with educational attainment.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program"], "topic": ["Education", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper studies the effect of minimum wages on employment using a dataset of labor market outcomes from 22 OECD countries between 1982 and 2016.", "dataset": ["dataset of labor market outcomes"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from multiple sources such as the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture, the National Sample Survey Office, and the Central Statistics Office to understand the impact of agricultural insurance on farmer income and crop yields in India.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture", "National Sample Survey Office", "Central Statistics Office"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using high-resolution satellite imagery and census data from Bangladesh, we find that an increase in exposure to air pollution is significantly associated with lower height-for-age scores among children aged 0-59 months.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite imagery", "census data from Bangladesh"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on three datasets - the Humanitarian Data Exchange, the Multi-Cluster Initial Rapid Assessment, and the ReliefWeb Crisis Dashboard - to identify the most vulnerable populations during a humanitarian crisis and inform aid distribution.", "dataset": ["Humanitarian Data Exchange", "Multi-Cluster Initial Rapid Assessment", "ReliefWeb Crisis Dashboard"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset on global stranded assets in the fossil fuel industry to estimate the direct and indirect financial risks that climate change poses to investors.", "dataset": ["unique dataset on global stranded assets in the fossil fuel industry"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the relationship between international migration and remittance flows, we use data from two sources: the World Bank Migration and Remittances database and the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs database.", "dataset": ["World Bank Migration and Remittances database", "United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs database"], "topic": ["Migration", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from 10 African countries, we show that access to rural roads has a positive effect on dietary diversity and nutritional outcomes, but the effect varies depending on the type of crop grown in the area.", "dataset": ["household survey data from 10 African countries"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data from the World Health Organization's Global Urban Ambient Air Pollution Database and the World Bank's Population Density Database to estimate the health impacts of air pollution in urban areas around the world.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization's Global Urban Ambient Air Pollution Database", "World Bank's Population Density Database"], "topic": ["Health", "Urban Development"]}]
